channel.title: INfinance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INfinance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: This 401(k) lawsuit showcases the power of a 50-year-old law
item.description: Erisa laid the foundation for retirement security, but more laws will bolster it in the years to come.

item.title: U.S. Stocks Mixed as Goldman Sachs, Bank of America Report Earnings
item.description: Major indexes were mixed. The Dow and the S&P 500 both closed at record highs Monday.

item.title: Goldman Sachs's Wall Street Businesses Gain Steam, Sending Profit Up 45%
item.description: The bank posted strong growth in investment banking and asset and wealth management.

item.title: Oil prices drop by 5% after report Israel won’t target Iran’s oil facilities

item.title: Walgreens’ stock seeing best day in years as company plans to close 1,200 stores

item.title: Euro Might Fall Over Medium-Term Even if ECB Offers Short-Term Boost

item.title: Activist Palliser Pushes for Change at AI Chip Investor SK Square
item.description: The hedge fund has built a more than 1% stake in the South Korean company, which is the largest shareholder in chip maker SK Hynix.

item.title: Wall Street’s most frustrating ‘pain trade’ looks set to continue

item.title: He Was a Monk, Then a Billionaire and Now an Alleged Tax Cheat
item.description: Michigan philanthropist Manoj Bhargava made a fortune on his path to enlightenment, and he doesn’t want to share it with the U.S. government.

item.title: Boeing’s bonds signal view that company has bought time with credit-raters to avoid slide to junk
